quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: It wears me down having to resend things over and over, like they’re testing how long I’ll last.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I understand, and I’ve told them it’s not acceptable practice.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Not acceptable? It’s abusive. They’re abusing the process to exhaust me.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I hear you, Ben, but I can’t confirm intent. What I can do is keep raising it.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Intent doesn’t matter when the effect is the same—me being broken down.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: That’s true, and I’ll keep highlighting the impact on you.

contradictions.issue: Victim frames resubmission cycle as abusive attrition; advocate refuses to confirm intent but concedes harm
